title: Linux ps Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the powerful Linux ps command and learn how to filter processes by user, monitor CPU and memory usage, and gain practical insights into system monitoring and management.

meta.title: Linux ps Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the powerful Linux ps command and learn how to filter processes by user, monitor CPU and memory usage, and gain practical insights into system monitoring and management.
meta.keywords: Linux, ps command, process monitoring, system management, CPU usage, memory usage

verify.name: Verify the ps command output
verify.hint: The `ps -ef` command did not return any processes owned by the `labex` user. Please ensure you have run the correct command to list all processes.

verify.name: Verify processes owned by labex user
verify.hint: The `ps -u labex` command did not return any processes owned by the `labex` user. Please ensure you have run the correct command to list all processes owned by the `labex` user.

verify.name: Verify CPU and memory usage output
verify.hint: The `ps -eo pid,user,%cpu,%mem,cmd` command did not return any processes owned by the `labex` user. Please ensure you have run the correct command to list the CPU and memory usage of running processes.
